newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY'S HOG LIVESTOCK RISES TO 5.8 MILLION-STAT.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY'S HOG LIVESTOCK RISES TO 5.8 MILLION-STAT.

text.p: Hungary's hog livestock stood at 5.80 million at August 1, up 14 percentage points over June 30, 1995, the Central Statistical Office (KSH) said in a statement.
The number of sows reached 426,000, rising three percentage points.
No KSH official was immediately available to explain why KSH compared the August 1 date to end of June last year.
"The situation of pig breeders continued to deteriorate in the reviewed period," KSH said, adding that individual breeders suffered the biggest falls in profitability.
"This will presumably induce an increase of meat price in the coming one year period," it said.
